commit_message:
Make sure the ISO tracks the latest merged code

After MOS 9.0 release main repositories are now freezed, and the latest
merged code lands into -proposed. Thus to keep development and CI for
stable/mitaka branch packages from proposed should be added to the ISO.

Change-Id: I8f7cd2fd221e3db5893f7a369696b13f29f83bd5
Closes-bug: #1619309
(cherry picked from commit c6bf2265d28edeb723d154230b1da48207b0f938)

commit_message:
standardize release note page ordering

In order to support automatically updating the release notes when we
create stable branches, we want the pages to be in a standard order.
This patch updates the order to be reverse chronological, so the most
recent notes appear at the top.

Change-Id: Ib364dcc8eb31275a31c83b68d7914263b183e393
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add proxy parameter for rhel registration

The option to use a proxy for automatic registration is
possible but not available in the existing templates. This
commit adds this.

Change-Id: I1d493eca59adc5fa374f32b341e0935575c3dc51
Signed-off-by: Christopher Brown <snecklifter@gmail.com>

subject: Fix wrong HA router state
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-07 05:28:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/efe472b7f159a0c8ba0dc6deb4b8949702f2f73e', 'message': 'Fix wrong HA router state

When we add/remove router interface from HA router, l3 agent
will send SIGHUP signal to keepalived for reloading configuraion.

But for DVR+HA router, l3 agent will send SIGHUP signal TWICE which
will cause VRRP sub-process terminated and vip addresses and routes
left over. Keepalived then restart VRRP process and there will be
a re-election between VRRP peers. Once the former master failed
election, there will be two active agent showed from Neutron.

class DvrEdgeHaRouter should not call enable_keepalived() by itself
because it has inherited from class HaRouter.

Change-Id: I647269665a22b4becb3e326e1f4b03ddd961d6b1
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-07 05:42:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ba29af923fd71208a233bf7f73f0ba8e973ef38b', 'message': 'Fix wrong HA router state

will cause VRRP sub-process terminated and vip addresses and routes

a re-election between VRRP peers. Once the former master failed

Closes-Bug: 1602320
Change-Id: I647269665a22b4becb3e326e1f4b03ddd961d6b1
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-07 07:00:51.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_ha_router.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2b148c3f9299642e0bb068983de68ec6441a23be', 'message': 'Fix wrong HA router state

When we add/remove router interface from HA router, l3 agent
will send SIGHUP signal to keepalived for reloading configuraion.

But for DVR+HA router, l3 agent will send SIGHUP signal TWICE which
will cause VRRP sub-process terminated and vip addresses and routes
left over. Keepalived then restart VRRP process and there will be
a re-election between VRRP peers. After the election, if the former
is still master, the state showed from Neutron will be correct. But
if the former master transitioned to backup, the new VRRP process
will NOT delete vips and routes because it is not the one who
configured them. There will be two active agent showed from Neutron.

HaRouter.enable_keepalived() will send SIGHUP signal to keepalived.
DvrEdgeHaRouter.process() should not call enable_keepalived() by
itself because it has inherited from class HaRouter.

Closes-Bug: 1602320
Change-Id: I647269665a22b4becb3e326e1f4b03ddd961d6b1
'}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong HA router state

When we add/remove router interface from HA router, l3 agent
will send SIGHUP signal to keepalived for reloading configuraion.

But for DVR+HA router, l3 agent will send SIGHUP signal TWICE which
will cause VRRP sub-process terminated and vip addresses and routes
left over. Keepalived then restart VRRP process and there will be
a re-election between VRRP peers. After the election, if the former
is still master, the state showed from Neutron will be correct. But
if the former master transitioned to backup, the new VRRP process
will NOT delete vips and routes because it is not the one who
configured them. There will be two active agent showed from Neutron.

HaRouter.enable_keepalived() will send SIGHUP signal to keepalived.
DvrEdgeHaRouter.process() should not call enable_keepalived() by
itself because it has inherited from class HaRouter.

Closes-Bug: 1602320
Change-Id: I647269665a22b4becb3e326e1f4b03ddd961d6b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/93/366493/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def process(self, agent): super(DvrEdgeHaRouter, self).process(agent) if self.ha_port: self.enable_keepalived()

commit_message:
Make sure the ISO tracks the latest merged code

After MOS 9.0 release main repositories are now freezed, and the latest
merged code lands into -proposed. Thus to keep development and CI for
stable/mitaka branch packages from proposed should be added to the ISO.

Closes-bug: #1619309

Change-Id: I8f7cd2fd221e3db5893f7a369696b13f29f83bd5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/49/347249/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: define debmirror_mos_ubuntu set -ex; debmirror --progress --checksums --nocleanup \ --nosource --ignore-release-gpg --rsync-extra=none \ --exclude-deb-section='^debug$$' \ --method=$(MIRROR_MOS_UBUNTU_METHOD) \ --host=$(MIRROR_MOS_UBUNTU) \ --root=$(MIRROR_MOS_UBUNTU_ROOT) \ --dist=$1 \ --section=$(subst $(space),$(comma),$(MIRROR_MOS_UBUNTU_SECTION)) \ --arch=$(UBUNTU_ARCH) \ $(LOCAL_MIRROR_UBUNTU)/ endef $(foreach dist,$(MIRROR_MOS_UBUNTU_SUITE) $(MIRROR_MOS_UBUNTU_SUITE)-proposed,$(call debmirror_mos_ubuntu $(dist))

commit_message:
Fix delayed calls DB migration

When running mistral-db-manage upgrade head on an empty DB, the migration
returns the error index unique_key does not exist. This patch adds a
check for the index before dropping the index.

Change-Id: I777557b7412f473006885cf003519f5df30e4f09
Closes-Bug: #1621644
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/74/367674/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from sqlalchemy.engine import reflection inspect = reflection.Inspector.from_engine(op.get_bind()) unique_constraints = [ uc['name'] for uc in inspect.get_unique_constraints('delayed_calls_v2') ] if 'delayed_calls_v2_processing_execution_time' in unique_constraints: op.drop_index( 'delayed_calls_v2_processing_execution_time', table_name='delayed_calls_v2' ) if 'unique_key' in unique_constraints: op.drop_index('unique_key', table_name='delayed_calls_v2')

commit_message:
Add keystone networks for the different endpoints

Keystone doesn't provide different flags to indicate that both of its
endpoints are enabled. So currently we have to manually add its
network to all-nodes-config.

bp tls-via-certmogner

Change-Id: Ibecd78706e84853107f698ba411a0c05e6f5be52
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/76/367176/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Added commands to manage deployment sequences

Commands:
  - fuel2 sequence create -r <release> -n <name> -t <graph_type1> [graph_typeN]
  - fuel2 sequence upload -r <release> --file <file_path>
  - fuel2 sequence download <id> [--file <file path>]
  - fuel2 sequence delete <id>
  - fuel2 sequence update <id> [-name <name>] [-t <graph_type1> [graph_typeN]]
  - fuel2 sequence list -r <release_id> | -e <env_id>
  - fuel2 sequence show <id>
  - fuel2 sequence execute <id> -e <env_id> [--force] [--dry-run] [--noop]

DocImpact
Change-Id: I6eb688c5cc91b2b3dbaa2fe5c52a69fe062da664
Partial-Bug: 1620620

commit_message:
Added post_test_hook.sh to fix broken gate-functional-dsvm-networking-sfc-nv

It appears that the error leading to FAILURE of
 gate-functional-dsvm-networking-sfc-nv
is bash: /opt/stack/new/networking-sfc/networking_sfc/tests/contrib/post_test_hook.sh: No such file or directory

This commit copies this file from the equivalent path in Neutron with a change
to a couple of lines to reference networking-sfc instead.

Change-Id: I587bf3ade6aa7cc1f4905f985acd9a5abd7a8545
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-sfc refs/changes/06/354006/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env bash set -xe NETWORKING_SFC_DIR="$BASE/new/networking-sfc" SCRIPTS_DIR="/usr/os-testr-env/bin/" venv=${1:-"dsvm-functional"} function generate_testr_results { # Give job user rights to access tox logs sudo -H -u $owner chmod o+rw . sudo -H -u $owner chmod o+rw -R .testrepository if [ -f ".testrepository/0" ] ; then .tox/$venv/bin/subunit-1to2 < .testrepository/0 > ./testrepository.subunit $SCRIPTS_DIR/subunit2html ./testrepository.subunit testr_results.html gzip -9 ./testrepository.subunit gzip -9 ./testr_results.html sudo mv ./*.gz /opt/stack/logs/ fi } if [[ "$venv" == dsvm-functional* ]] || [[ "$venv" == dsvm-fullstack* ]] then owner=stack sudo_env= # Set owner permissions according to job's requirements. cd $NETWORKING_SFC_DIR sudo chown -R $owner:stack $NETWORKING_SFC_DIR # Run tests echo "Running networking-sfc $venv test suite" set +e sudo -H -u $owner $sudo_env tox -e $venv testr_exit_code=$? set -e # Collect and parse results generate_testr_results exit $testr_exit_code fi

commit_message:
Make pip_install honour pip_install_options

Add a pip_install_options variable to the extra_args parameter of
the Ínstall pip packages task.

The variable is set to a default value of "" in the roles default
variables.

Change-Id: I3ffead4f63c85215c2d6b6fec5a02837cc7f7551
Closes-Bug: 1620872
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-pip_install refs/changes/08/367708/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ## Additional options to pass to pip # Example: # pip_install_options: "--cert /etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt" # # See the documentationat https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/reference/pip # for details. pip_install_options: ""

commit_message:
standardize release note page ordering

In order to support automatically updating the release notes when we
create stable branches, we want the pages to be in a standard order.
This patch updates the order to be reverse chronological, so the most
recent notes appear at the top.

Change-Id: Ib364dcc8eb31275a31c83b68d7914263b183e393
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Deleting volume metadata keys with a single request

Deleting multiple volume metadata keys with a single request to
improve performance. This patch uses etags to avoid the lost update
problem with volume metadata. To inject the response's `Etag` header
the index method returns webob.Response object with this tag.

APIImpact
Related blueprint: delete-multiple-metadata-keys
Change-Id: I575635258c10f299181b8e4cdb51a7ad1f1be764
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/99/328399/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import hashlibfrom oslo_serialization import jsonutils return self._inject_checksum_header(req, volume_id) def _inject_checksum_header(self, req, volume_id): metadata = self._get_metadata(context, volume_id) resp = webob.Response() data = jsonutils.dumps({"metadata": metadata}) resp.headers['Etag'] = hashlib.md5(data).hexdigest() resp.body = data return resp
deleted_lines: """Returns the list of metadata for a given volume.""" return {'metadata': self._get_metadata(context, volume_id)}

commit_message:
Improve logging system

* --debug option added
* Logging for exceptions in checkers extended
* Some test coverage improvements
* Added support for external log facility

Change-Id: I856e19a9f22bb1145377ccd5d49e8fc4b9ecf733

commit_message:
Update log_file documentation

log_file should be set to $::os_service_default and not to the boolean
false because the boolean false gets interpreted as a file name.

Change-Id: I2b7f3ad6f04b24e357948bd23782b89764e632e5

commit_message:
Fix path of jquery-ui.css in congress_dashboard

jquery-ui.css path has been changed in horizon, which caused
gate failure in congress_dashboard. This commit updates the
path as proposed in bug #1615763 .

Change-Id: If092f730c2a1557e22a241d5f2c35a6792cb47c9
Closes-Bug: #1615763

commit_message:
Ironic Client: Bump the max_retries and retry_interval

This patch is bumping the max_retries and retry_interval when
instantiating the Ironic client to 60 seconds. This is to workaround the
NodeLocked problem that might happen to some baremetal commands.

Looking at some TripleO-CI logs it's not uncommon to see this exception
being raised when it's registering nodes in Ironic, that's because
commands like --register-nodes does also change the node's state to move
it from "manageable" to "available" which may conflict with the periodic
task in the Ironic conductor syncing the power state.

A FIXME was left in the code noting that we should use the
ironicclient.get_client() functions instead of instantiating the
Client() class directly, that's because the Client() class does not
validate any parameters.

This patch also adds a new unittest module for the actions/base.py which
is currently not unittested at all.

Closes-Bug: #1612622
Change-Id: I09501ee989d881b727434275fc0384fb5b67aa32
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/94/365694/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # FIXME(lucasagomes): Use ironicclient.get_client() instead # of ironicclient.Client(). Client() might cause errors since # it doesn't verify the provided arguments, get_client() is the # prefered way os_ironic_api_version='1.11', max_retries=12, retry_interval=5,

subject: Fix reading files that are symlinks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-17 22:22:50.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/common/operating_system.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/994e276609a26d37f4d5f51f576899e4b43a5368', 'message': 'Fix reading files that are symlinks

Symlinks need to be dereferenced when reading a file as root.
Trove needs to make a temporary copy of the target file to read from.
The library by default copies the symlink and subsequently fails
to delete the temporary file.

Change-Id: I0a2f0661e2b13cf77d110cbdf0a78f215964018a
Closes-Bug: 1614288
'}]
commit_message:
Fix reading files that are symlinks

Symlinks need to be dereferenced when reading a file as root.
Trove needs to make a temporary copy of the target file to read from.
The library by default copies the symlink and subsequently fails
to delete the temporary file.

Change-Id: I0a2f0661e2b13cf77d110cbdf0a78f215964018a
Closes-Bug: 1614288

deleted_lines: copy(path, fp.name, force=True, as_root=True) **kwargs): options = (('f', force), ('p', preserve), ('R', recursive))

commit_message:
Increase cluster_complete timeouts

Since the call involves getting the real database status
it can easily take longer than 5s on a slower/loaded instance.

Use the HIGH guestagent timeout.

Affected datastores:

 - Cassandra
 - MongoDB

Other datastore have been using the HIGH timeout already.

Change-Id: Ifbece0ae9ca30e64b0796e682687f886516993a1
Closes-Bug: 1614227

commit_message:
Documentation for installing and using Ironic in overcloud

The new guide leads an operator through installation of a hybrid environment
with both bare metal and virtual instances. For simplicity a single flat
physical network is assumed.

Change-Id: I6f18ab09084b614dfca833da85b1f10aadbe80d1
Implements: blueprint ironic-integration

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-ui refs/changes/01/367901/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: isCurrentPaneInvalid() { var {pane} = this.refs; if (!pane) return null; // FIXME(jkirnosova): pane validation should be provided by one method var hasErrors = _.isFunction(pane.isValid) && !pane.isValid() || _.isFunction(pane.constructor.hasErrors) && pane.constructor.hasErrors(this.wizard); if (hasErrors) this.updateState({paneHasErrors: true}); return hasErrors; if (this.isCurrentPaneInvalid()) return; if (index > this.state.maxAvailablePaneIndex) return; if (index > this.state.activePaneIndex && this.isCurrentPaneInvalid()) return; if (this.stopHandlingKeys) return;
deleted_lines: isCurrentPaneValid() { var pane = this.refs.pane; if (pane && _.isFunction(pane.isValid) && !pane.isValid()) { this.updateState({paneHasErrors: true}); return false; } return true; // check for pane's validation errors if (!this.isCurrentPaneValid()) { return; } // check for pane's validation errors if (!this.isCurrentPaneValid()) { return; } if (index > this.state.maxAvailablePaneIndex) { return; } // check for pane's validation errors if (!this.isCurrentPaneValid()) { return; } if (this.stopHandlingKeys) { return; }

commit_message:
gate_hook: Compile ovs only with supported kernels

The intention of this patch is not to break current compilations on
Xenial boxes that run with 4.4 kernel which is not supported by OVS
openvswitch kernel module. After we are confident to switch master
branch to be running on Xenial only, we will get rid of the compilation
itself until it's needed by other features.

Change-Id: I1c890bf5a6564a69e36b8289a5d8dc0deee2a429
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/80/364880/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # is_kernel_supported() - OVS supports only kernel up to 4.3.x function is_kernel_supported { major=$(uname -r | cut -d\. -f 1) minor=$(uname -r | cut -d\. -f 2) if [ $major -le 4 -a $minor -le 3 ]; then return 0 fi return 1 }

commit_message:
Fix client could not init glance client

Now the client can not initialise glance client,
give the warning msg like:
# murano environment-create test-env
Could not initialise glance client. Image creation will be unavailable.

Have two issue about this:
1. can not get the endpoint correctly, the get endpoint
are all murano's endpoint. This is due to when get the endpoint, if have
the endpoint, will return this endpoint directly.
2. Get the correctly endpoint, init the glance client, give the error:
TypeError: "__init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'endpoint_type'"
This is due to 'endpoint_type' argument.

Change-Id: I87df369eecc9b79cb7173967729351f7e601edc0
Closes-bug: #1594731
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-muranoclient refs/changes/28/332028/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
WIP wire in jinja templating for custom roles

We probably want this to go in tripleo-common and be driven via mistral,
but since the deployment aspects of that are still WIP, wire it in
via tripleoclient to enable custom-roles prototyping to proceed.

Change-Id: I1851d1dca30bf2df1f0b99ec2a97c819d8420b71
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/25/336625/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import jinja2 if template_path.endswith(constants.OVERCLOUD_J2_NAME): self._j2_template_roles(template_path) def _j2_template_roles(self, tht_root): # FIXME(shardy) add error paths for missing files # Get role data list j2_roles_path = os.path.join(tht_root, constants.OVERCLOUD_J2_ROLES_NAME) with open(j2_roles_path, 'r') as roles_file: role_data = yaml.safe_load(roles_file) # Render the j2 template j2_overcloud_path = os.path.join(tht_root, constants.OVERCLOUD_J2_NAME) loader = jinja2.FileSystemLoader(j2_overcloud_path) env = jinja2.Environment(loader=loader) template = env.get_template('') oc_template = template.render(roles=role_data) # Write the result to overcloud.yaml overcloud_path = os.path.join(tht_root, constants.OVERCLOUD_YAML_NAME) with open(overcloud_path, 'w') as overcloud_file: overcloud_file.write(oc_template) # Attempt to create overcloud.yaml from OVERCLOUD_J2_NAME # If this fails we fall back to the old behavior where one of # constants.OVERCLOUD_YAML_NAMES will exist in tht_root self._j2_template_roles(tht_root)

commit_message:
Bump puppet-murano version

We need to bump puppet-murano version to unlock upstream fix
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/365949/ which
changes the way Murano dashboard executes collectstatic
when we use UCA packages.

Change-Id: I4fe2f697a185f28a91952a253266a6ef69cff86e
Closes-Bug: #1603528

commit_message:
Block graphviz 0.5.0

Currently kolla gate jobs are failing due to issues in graphviz 0.5.0. [1]

We need to unblock the gates by blocking graphviz===0.5.0.

FFE request : http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-September/103295.html

Change-Id: If96d5f6481fe2c9732d6121c2b677c7da262cf8a

commit_message:
Override allNodes redis_vip with correct RedisVirtualIP value

This is hard-coded into the controller template atm, so instead
pass a mapping into the allNodesConfig which can be merged to override
special cases where the per-network VIP isn't used.

Change-Id: I92748cf3ea527af8ea0f812ec3825bccd581686e
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles

commit_message:
Remove now redundant heat configuration

Some of these options are now redundant:

*_server_url is now calculated from the heat keystone endpoint so
we don't need to duplicate the endpoint data in the heat.conf

instance_user is no longer supported by heat at all and should be

commit_message:
standardize release note page ordering

In order to support automatically updating the release notes
when we create stable branches, we want the pages to be in a
standard order. This patch updates the order to be reverse chronological,
so the most recent notes appear at the top.

Change-Id: Ie720294e2f0601991fded59a64fe83460e15d563

commit_message:
Host selection when creating backup

If CONF.backup_use_same_host is set, it means backup
service is installed in same host as volume service.

When creating a backup from volume, Cinder needs to
select volume's host to create backup.

Change-Id: I3e41ca855f9ff0fdb424bcf9850dfd83cd980daf
Closes-Bug: #1616810
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/49/360349/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines: var {wizard} = this.props; if ((cluster.validationError || {}).name) { previousEnabled: false, this.setState(_.merge(nextState, { createVisible: nextActivePaneIndex === numberOfPanes - 1 })); isCurrentPaneInvalid() { var {pane} = this.refs; if (!pane) return null; // FIXME(jkirnosova): pane validation should be provided by one method return _.isFunction(pane.isValid) && !pane.isValid() || _.isFunction(pane.constructor.hasErrors) && pane.constructor.hasErrors(this.wizard); if (this.isCurrentPaneInvalid()) return; var {activePaneIndex, maxAvailablePaneIndex} = this.state; if ( index > maxAvailablePaneIndex || index > activePaneIndex && this.isCurrentPaneInvalid() ) return; if (this.stopHandlingKeys) return; var {actionInProgress, previousEnabled, nextVisible, createVisible} = this.state; disabled={this.isCurrentPaneInvalid() || actionInProgress}

Add fields to csv reports

This adds the UserId, ProjectId, ItemName, ItemFlavor, Service and Cost
fields to the csv reports.

commit_message:
Enable j2 rendering of any file, not just overcloud.yaml

We now have a requirement to render the puppet/post.yaml file
so just iterate over the plan file listing to future proof this
process.

Change-Id: Ifb423fe942fbe8108d286e815e5b2a9ee89b18a4
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/77/366877/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Iterate over all files in the plan container # we j2 render any with the .j2.yaml suffix container_files = swift.get_container(self.container) if not container_files: raise ValueError("No files found in container %s" % self.container) else: LOG.info("SHDEBUG container_files[1] = %s" % container_files[1]) files_list = [ f.get('name') for f in container_files[1] ] LOG.info("SHDEBUG files=%s" % str(files_list)) for f in files_list: # check to see if the file is a *.j2.yaml # if it is, get it and template for roles if f.endswith('.j2.yaml'): j2_template = swift.get_object(self.container, f)[1] # Render the j2 template template = jinja2.Environment().from_string(j2_template) r_template = template.render(roles=role_data) # write the template back to the plan container swift.put_object( self.container, f.replace('.j2.yaml', '.yaml'), r_template)
deleted_lines: # check to see if jinja template exists j2_overcloud_template = swift.get_object( self.container, constants.OVERCLOUD_J2_NAME)[1] # check to see if roles data exists # Render the j2 template template = jinja2.Environment().from_string(j2_overcloud_template) oc_template = template.render(roles=role_data) # write the template back swift.put_object( self.container, constants.OVERCLOUD_YAML_NAME, oc_template)

commit_message:
Add CSV support to cloudkitty-writer

This feature makes it possible to get your reports in CSV format.

It is now possible to set "pipeline" to csv in the [output] section
of cloudkitty.conf.

Co-Authored-By: Stéphane Albert <sheeprine@nullplace.com>

Change-Id: Ibba250462852906d43534cadf3f62f295c3136db

added_lines: # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # Copyright 2014 Objectif Libre # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # @author: Stéphane Albert # import collections import datetime from cloudkitty.writer import csv_base class CSVMapped(csv_base.BaseCSVBackend): report_type = 'csv' def __init__(self, write_orchestrator, user_id, backend, state_backend): super(CSVMapped, self).__init__(write_orchestrator, user_id, backend, state_backend) # Detailed transform dict self._field_map = collections.OrderedDict( [('UsageStart', self._trans_get_usage_start), ('UsageEnd', self._trans_get_usage_end), ('ResourceId', self._trans_res_id), ('Operation', self._trans_operation), ('AvailabilityZone', 'desc:availability_zone'), ('ItemDescription', 'rating:description'), ('UsageQuantity', 'vol:qty'), ('RateId', 'rating:rate_id'), ('RateValue', 'rating:price'), ('user:*', 'desc:metadata:*')]) def _write_total(self): lines = [[''] * self._headers_len for i in range(3)] for i in range(len(lines)): lines[i][1] = self._tenant_id lines[1][2] = self._tenant_id lines[0][3] = 'InvoiceTotal' lines[1][3] = 'AccountTotal' lines[2][3] = 'StatementTotal' lines[0][5] = 'Total amount for invoice' lines[1][5] = 'Total for linked account# {}'.format(self._tenant_id) start_month = datetime.datetime( self.usage_start_dt.year, self.usage_start_dt.month, 1) lines[2][5] = ('Total statement amount for period ' '{} - {}').format(self._format_date(start_month), self._get_usage_end()) lines[0][8] = self.total lines[1][8] = self.total lines[2][8] = self.total self._csv_report.writerows(lines) @staticmethod def _format_date(raw_dt): return raw_dt.strftime('%Y/%m/%d %H:%M:%S') def _get_usage_start(self): """Get the start usage of this period. """ if self.cached_start == self.usage_start: return self.cached_start_str else: self.cached_start = self.usage_start self.cached_start_str = self._format_date(self.usage_start_dt) return self.cached_start_str def _get_usage_end(self): """Get the end usage of this period. """ if self.cached_start == self.usage_start and self.cached_end_str: return self.cached_end_str else: usage_end = self.usage_start_dt + datetime.timedelta( seconds=self._period) self.cached_end_str = self._format_date(usage_end) return self.cached_end_str def _trans_get_usage_start(self, _context, _report_data): """Dummy transformation function to comply with the standard. """ return self._get_usage_start() def _trans_get_usage_end(self, _context, _report_data): """Dummy transformation function to comply with the standard. """ return self._get_usage_end() def _trans_product_name(self, context, _report_data): """Context dependent product name translation. """ if context == 'compute': return 'Nova Computing' else: return context def _trans_operation(self, context, _report_data): """Context dependent operation translation. """ if context == 'compute': return 'RunInstances' def _trans_res_id(self, context, report_data): """Context dependent resource id transformation function. """ if context == 'compute': return report_data['desc'].get('instance_id')

commit_message:
Drop unused directory in tox

The Oslo team has moved all previously incubated code from the
'openstack/oslo-incubator' repository into separate library
repositories and released those libraries to the Python Package,
so the directory should be removed.

Change-Id: I0ee30c36e87970bc1b1175230a1bffa27e0b3e09

commit_message:
Added commands to manage deployment sequences

Commands:
  - fuel2 sequence create -r <release> -n <name> -t <graph_type1> [graph_typeN]
  - fuel2 sequence upload -r <release> --file <file_path>
  - fuel2 sequence download <id> [--file <file path>]
  - fuel2 sequence delete <id>
  - fuel2 sequence update <id> [-name <name>] [-t <graph_type1> [graph_typeN]]
  - fuel2 sequence list -r <release_id> | -e <env_id>
  - fuel2 sequence show <id>
  - fuel2 sequence execute <id> -e <env_id> [--force] [--dry-run] [--noop]

DocImpact
Change-Id: I6eb688c5cc91b2b3dbaa2fe5c52a69fe062da664
Partial-Bug: 1620620

commit_message:
Itroduced deployment sequences

Deployment sequence is a mechanism for saving
recently used sequences of graphs in database
for further execution.
Sequences are related to release object.

Partial-Bug: 1620620
Change-Id: I23ce74e8edbab579d6704a947d89e8d6e9c58fb7

added_lines: from nailgun import transactions class TransactionExecutorHandler(BaseHandler): def start_transaction(self, cluster, options): """Starts new transaction. :param cluster: the cluster object :param options: the transaction parameters :return: JSONized task object """ try: manager = transactions.TransactionsManager(cluster.id) self.raise_task(manager.execute(**options)) except errors.ObjectNotFound as e: raise self.http(404, e.message) except errors.DeploymentAlreadyStarted as e: raise self.http(409, e.message) except errors.InvalidData as e: raise self.http(400, e.message)

commit_message:
Add UnionDict class for lcm

We don't merge common_attrs with node's custom attributes
in deployment info. But YAQL expressions still need to
access 'unified' deployment info, related to node. So
we were merging dicts every time yaql want to access it.
It's a bit slow, so this patch introduces class, which
works like union of several dicts without creation of the new
data structure.

Partial-Bug: #1596987

Change-Id: Iea32ab222421fc7a3c5df66e7e48f4d1a4b931f5
(cherry picked from commit 1f31a850b8f162952b2b3fd816e005bf93e566ee)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/92/367592/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Don't use nested transaction in provisioning blocks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-08 06:15:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/56a98093f64649122e5b1fe490c386ae813a989d', 'message': "Don't use nested transaction in provisioning blocks

Relying on duplicate entries for existing provisioning
block detection led to lots of log noise whenever we
would encounter a deadlock because the savepoint would
go missing. Additionally, since this would happen inside
of another transaction, we couldn't be guarunteed until
the final commit that this was unique anyway so the whole
transaction could throw a duplicate exception.

Since the outer transaction has to handle duplicate exceptions
anyway, this patch just adjusts the logic to check for the
existing of a record first with a regular query. If there
is a race the outer transaction will still fail with a duplicate
as before, but we at least won't have a bunch of missing savepoint
exception noise.

Change-Id: I02d30427505591e24d7bdc1ba654d3757ab9a33d
Closes-Bug: #1616126

commit_message:
Don't use nested transaction in provisioning blocks

Relying on duplicate entries for existing provisioning
block detection led to lots of log noise whenever we
would encounter a deadlock because the savepoint would
go missing. Additionally, since this would happen inside
of another transaction, we couldn't be guaranteed until
the final commit that this was unique anyway so the whole
transaction could throw a duplicate exception.

Since the outer transaction has to handle duplicate exceptions
anyway, this patch just adjusts the logic to check for the
existing of a record first with a regular query. If there
is a race the outer transaction will still fail with a duplicate
as before, but we at least won't have a bunch of missing savepoint
exception noise.

Closes-Bug: #1613759
Change-Id: I02d30427505591e24d7bdc1ba654d3757ab9a33d

commit_message:
Fix popover position on zoomed in deployment timeline

Popover position for deployment tasks are now positioned
depending on mouse position.

Closes-Bug: #1621547

Change-Id: I13ae9c25c8f2e83496731ecc3e7d87b6ab6fecb9

added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2016-09-09 04:50+0000\n""PO-Revision-Date: 2016-09-08 09:51+0000\n"msgid "" "In the provider networks architecture, all instances attach directly to the " "provider network. In the self-service (private) networks architecture, " "instances can attach to a self-service or provider network. Self-service " "networks can reside entirely within OpenStack or provide some level of " "external network access using :term:`NAT <Network Address Translation " "(NAT)>` through the provider network." msgstr "" "Dans une architecture réseaux fournisseur, toutes les instances sont " "directement attachées au réseau fournisseur. Dans une architecture réseaux " "self-service (privés), les instances peuvent s'attacher à un réseau self-" "service ou fournisseur. Les réseaux self-service peuvent résider entièrement " "à l'intérieur du périmètre OpenStack ou fournir un certain niveau d'accès au " "réseau externe en utilisant le :term:`NAT <Network Address Translation " "(NAT)>` via le réseau fournisseur." "To enable other nodes to connect to the chrony daemon on the controller " "node, add the following key to the ``/etc/chrony.conf`` file:" msgstr "" "Pour permettre aux autres nœuds de se connecter au daemon chrony sur le nœud " "contrôleur, ajouter la clé suivante dans le fichier ``/etc/chrony.conf``:" msgid ""

subject: objects: remove support for multiple db models in from_db_object
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-28 12:07:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f8121f3e70e81d8dc0d405dc43458d37dcfa80c0', 'message': 'objects: remove support for multiple db models in from_db_object

This was once implemented to allow objects that aggregate attributes
from multiple models. Specifically, that was the original design for QoS
rules, where we had a model with common attributes, and then a separate
model with rule specific attributes.

After a while, struggling to make it work without huge hacks, and after
rethinking database schema, we dropped the original design for QoS
rules, replacing it with a single model per type.

This patch cleans up the remnants of those dark ages of QoS.

This should make the code a bit more clear to readers who currently
wonder why we may have multiple database models for the same versioned
object.

Change-Id: I6a083f95ec02f61ced8f7ad0117560347d64b369
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
objects: remove support for multiple db models in from_db_object

This was once implemented to allow objects that aggregate attributes
from multiple models. Specifically, that was the original design for QoS
rules, where we had a model with common attributes, and then a separate
model with rule specific attributes.

After a while, struggling to make it work without huge hacks, and after
rethinking database schema, we dropped the original design for QoS
rules, replacing it with a single model per type.

This patch cleans up the remnants of those dark ages of QoS.

This should make the code a bit more clear to readers who currently
wonder why we may have multiple database models for the same versioned
object.

Change-Id: I6a083f95ec02f61ced8f7ad0117560347d64b369
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/71/348271/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def from_db_object(self, db_obj): fields = self.modify_fields_from_db(db_obj) for field in self.fields: if field in fields and not self.is_synthetic(field): setattr(self, field, fields[field])
deleted_lines: def from_db_object(self, *objs): db_objs = [self.modify_fields_from_db(db_obj) for db_obj in objs] for field in self.fields: for db_obj in db_objs: if field in db_obj and not self.is_synthetic(field): setattr(self, field, db_obj[field]) break

commit_message:
Add global_config_settings to services' output

The new global_config_settings output is meant to contain
additional hieradata distributed by the services to all role types.

Change-Id: I1beff8f7b12a4178e6081de6134cd8e67794d710

commit_message:
Added opts argument to mount_fs method

On centos bootstrap we don't able to mount images without '-o loop'
option in mount command because of old version of util-linux-ng package.
That's why opts argument in mount_fs method is needed in order to set
options for mount command.

Closes-Bug: #1620998
Change-Id: Iedfdf4aaeec35c99a0ddc96a2edfc59ac5bdb86e

commit_message:
change configdrive format to ConfigDrive version 2

We put configdrive with is9660 filesystem to a
partition on a hard disk. New hard disks may have
4K sectors, but blocksize of iso9660 fs is 2K so
it will not work.

To fix this bug we should use another filesystem (ext2)
and another config drive format (files, directory
structure), because NoCloud format, which is currently
used support only vfat and iso9660 filesystems.

Change-Id: Ia0f244f19bab3dfaceef8a092ad03667675a5557
Closes-Bug: #1544818
(cherry picked from commit d58de668f6b86aac2ff526a6e1eb1486ccb41bc5)

added_lines: def _make_configdrive_image(self, src_files): bs = 4096 configdrive_device = self.driver.partition_scheme.configdrive_device() size = utils.execute('blockdev', '--getsize64', configdrive_device)[0] size = int(size.strip()) utils.execute('truncate', '--size=%d' % size, CONF.config_drive_path) fu.make_fs( fs_type='ext2', fs_options=' -b %d -F ' % bs, fs_label='config-2', dev=six.text_type(CONF.config_drive_path)) mount_point = tempfile.mkdtemp(dir=CONF.tmp_path) try: fu.mount_fs('ext2', CONF.config_drive_path, mount_point) for file_path in src_files: name = os.path.basename(file_path) if os.path.isdir(file_path): shutil.copytree(file_path, os.path.join(mount_point, name)) else: shutil.copy2(file_path, mount_point) except Exception as exc: LOG.error('Error copying files to configdrive: %s', exc) raise finally: fu.umount_fs(mount_point) os.rmdir(mount_point) def _prepare_configdrive_files(self): # see data sources part of cloud-init documentation # for directory structure cd_root = tempfile.mkdtemp(dir=CONF.tmp_path) cd_latest = os.path.join(cd_root, 'openstack', 'latest') md_output_path = os.path.join(cd_latest, 'meta_data.json') ud_output_path = os.path.join(cd_latest, 'user_data') os.makedirs(cd_latest) self.driver.configdrive_scheme.template_names('meta_data_json'), utils.execute( 'write-mime-multipart', '--output=%s' % ud_output_path, '%s:text/cloud-boothook' % bh_output_path, '%s:text/cloud-config' % cc_output_path) return [os.path.join(cd_root, 'openstack')] def do_configdrive(self): LOG.debug('--- Creating configdrive (do_configdrive) ---') if CONF.prepare_configdrive: files = self._prepare_configdrive_files() self._make_configdrive_image(files) if CONF.prepare_configdrive or os.path.isfile(CONF.config_drive_path): self._add_configdrive_image() def _add_configdrive_image(self): fs_type = fu.get_fs_type(CONF.config_drive_path) format=fs_type,

commit_message:
Fix popover position on zoomed in deployment timeline

Popover position for deployment tasks are now positioned
depending on mouse position.

Closes-Bug: #1621547

Change-Id: I13ae9c25c8f2e83496731ecc3e7d87b6ab6fecb9

History:

libvirt 1.3.3 had added perf event support for cmt, mbmt, mbml support
when we landing the spec
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/support-perf-event .

For the event cmt, mbmt, mbml, we requires that libvirt to expose some
some specify cpu features, but libvirt 2.0.0 only has that expose merged
`cpu_map.xml: add cmt/mbm feature to x86 (Qiaowei Ren)`, the capabilities
changed to:

<feature name='mbm_total'/>
<feature name='mbm_local'/>
<feature name='cmt'/>

Need to adopt this to let nova driver discover these features when
enable cmt, mbmt, mbml event.

That is to say: even libvirt 1.3.3 has support perf event, but nova
cannot get noticed since libvirt don't expose cpu features until 2.0.0.

This patch bump MIN_LIBVIRT_PERF_VERSION to 2.0.0, see:
https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsPerf

Closes-Bug: #1620445
Change-Id: Ie896cfd478f4528903ca5dd56c61680837b646b7
"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-09-08 01:05:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ffb8531234f9d1f0c34887d0988741c5bc3bbbef', 'message': "Libvirt: Correct PERF_EVENTS_CPU_FLAG_MAPPING

commit_message:
Libvirt: Correct PERF_EVENTS_CPU_FLAG_MAPPING

History:

libvirt 1.3.3 had added perf event support for cmt, mbmt, mbml support
when we landing the spec
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/support-perf-event .

For the event cmt, mbmt, mbml, we requires that libvirt to expose some
some specify cpu features, but libvirt 2.0.0 only has that expose merged
`cpu_map.xml: add cmt/mbm feature to x86 (Qiaowei Ren)`, the capabilities
changed to:

<feature name='mbm_total'/>
<feature name='mbm_local'/>
<feature name='cmt'/>

Need to adopt this to let nova driver discover these features when
enable cmt, mbmt, mbml event.

That is to say: even libvirt 1.3.3 has support perf event, but nova
cannot get noticed since libvirt don't expose cpu features until 2.0.0.

This patch bump MIN_LIBVIRT_PERF_VERSION to 2.0.0, see:
https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsPerf

Closes-Bug: #1620445
Change-Id: Ie896cfd478f4528903ca5dd56c61680837b646b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/42/365842/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PERF_EVENTS_CPU_FLAG_MAPPING = {'cmt': 'cmt', 'mbml': 'mbm_local', 'mbmt': 'mbm_total',

commit_message:
DHCP: remove deprecated config dhcp_lease_time

This was marked as deprecated in commit 95dbd03a0bc4867bf8520539ed08f4068adf2f33.
That was in Havana. We have given enough time for admins
to upgrade to the new variable - dhcp_lease_duration.

UpgradeImpact
TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ie08c8f66b84cc577a99355f6977f946398b0a94a

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-05 01:21:15.000000000', 'files': ['tests/ci/sync_requirements.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/8cab7558f409d305b96b972a6b83e65f0ecb9a40', 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave
as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I1526522261cc315c91472b4342aa8842637db56c
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave
as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I1526522261cc315c91472b4342aa8842637db56c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/79/365379/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __ne__(self, other): return not self.__eq__(other)

commit_message:
scenario002: deploy Swift

Add Swift to scenario002 and switch Glance backend to use Swift storage.

Note: scenario002 now looks very similar to regular multinode job, this
is going to change as we'll add more services in scenario002. Now we
keep the non-ha multinode job to be run all the time, since scenarios
are only run at demand when Zuul thinks we need it.

Change-Id: I29ed91bef3ee822453b064ee1fd28e4549a4e130

commit_message:
Fix git service folder create task

The attempt to resolve the issue of a pre-existing
link in the place of the directory
( https://review.openstack.org/367563 ) did not work
as the file module requires a source and dest when
implementing a link.

This patch separates the task and only executes the
directory create if there is no link in place.

As per https://github.com/willthames/ansible-lint/issues/161
the mode for all directories is set to include a leading
zero to ensure that it's enforced as octal.

Change-Id: I27a64e8edaee1f652a4b3a95d05941df34824660

commit_message:
Move new ceph options to use ceph class parameters

The upstream change [1] added some new osd parameters to the ceph
class. This change updates our configuration of these parameters.
Also, this change fixes one mistake in the $ceph_tuning_settings
parameters and noop tests.

[1] I87fe265370adaf1c02e23ffe6ad63bdc93649438

Change-Id: I9f44e5ce2742eada57274373b591ef1946222099
Closes-Bug: #1603207
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/15/367415/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: osd_max_backfills => $osd_max_backfills, osd_recovery_max_active => $osd_recovery_max_active, osd_op_threads => $ceph_tuning_settings['osd_op_threads'], 'osd/journal_max_write_bytes' : value => $ceph_tuning_settings['journal_max_write_bytes'];

commit_message:
Reduce bluebox-sjc1 by 1 node

Because of our quota in bluebox-sjc1 it is possible for a subnode to
be over allocated in bluebox.

  Forbidden: Quota exceeded for cores, instances: Requested 8, 1, but
  already used 312, 39 of 312, 39 cores, instances (HTTP 403)
  (Request-ID: req-f0cdc99a-cbe0-4ecf-9438-eafc2c25b8a1)

It is possible there is an issue with nodepool calculating the
capacity, until then we'll just reduce bluebox by 1.

Change-Id: I73780c49044d91e8eb31076bbd87aa3a0c70ae91
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
setup post job for sahara-extra

this changes setups additional post job for sahara-extra artifacts.
we already have the script that make all needed build operations, and
it lives in sahara-extra repository.

since some these artifacts should be stored per branch, we are passing
branch as argument of the script so that after successful build all
needed stuff will be in to appropriate place ('dist/newton/' directory
for example).

Change-Id: I2d2a29f71ba11da46c9a313132af39709cc1ef61

commit_message:
Create a release notes job for glanceclient

Currently the release notes are not getting published for the
python-glanceclient library. This commit introduces the release notes
job that should enable publishing.

http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/python-glanceclient

Change-Id: I1c526c5715293bb51a6ce3db5519e3771f0a6251

commit_message:
Grafana Neutron: use string substitution to track jobs running on different nodes

This is a lot more future proof and consistent with how it's been done in
other places.

Change-Id: I57980495589dca62ae4b4661aaae64d2126ff846

commit_message:
New Project timmy - ansible-like tool

for parallel OpenStack node operations: two-way data transfer,
log collection, remote command execution.
It is configured by default to collect diagnostic snapshot from
OpenStack cloud deployed by Fuel.

The tool is based on [1].

Additional specification is available on the website [2].

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/openstack-diagnostics
[2] http://timmy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/specification.html

Change-Id: Ice5198c76639aa4089e787bff48b2d9cdb876424

Avoids error 500

In these cases, this cache would work well.

commit_message:
Add caching on get_all_runs_time_series_by_key for homepage

This commit adds caching on get_all_runs_time_series_by_key() which is
called from the home page requests. Recently, the home page loading time
is so long and I'm really annoyed every time. So I hope this could
reduce the time.

This call might have a high cache miss percentage because the start/stop
date, grouping, etc. parameters are changed frequently.

However, in my environment, this patch halves the loading time on
average[1]. I think this would be good when like below cases:
 1. Share a URL with parameters in case of telling others in emails,
    etherpads, and so on.
 2. Open a URL with parameters from your bookmarks.
 3. Some people access same url for an hour.
In these cases, this cache would work well.

[1] I tested this with reloading browser. It reduced 12.1 to 6.1 sec.

Change-Id: I402e34a42a898342c5c4a5cce822b07805452998

commit_message:
tripleo/upgrades: move jobs to check

nonha-multinode-updates-nv and undercloud-upgrades-nv are now passing
and ready to be in check pipeline.

undercloud-upgrades-nv will be run on instack-undercloud and tripleo-ci
projects only but nonha-multinode-updates-nv will be run on all TripleO
projects. Both jobs will remain non-voting for now.

Change-Id: I04d436a6c6d578aa0756b947365c7befa7e75839

commit_message:
Add missing index on inserted_primary_key in migration

MySQL doesn't seem to care, but Postgres and MariaDB barf on it.

Also add a test with data for this migration.

Change-Id: Ie464a65b291e5974a23e9b45de1654709092b4ad
Closes-Bug: #1621490

Create a network for segments to belong to net_id = uuidutils.generate_uuid() _create_record_with_sa(engine, 'networks', { 'id': net_id, 'name': '97c25b0d2353'}) # Create some segments with old model ns_table = db_utils.get_table(engine, 'networksegments') for s in range(5): engine.execute(ns_table.insert().values({ 'id': uuidutils.generate_uuid(), 'network_id': net_id, 'network_type': 'flat'})) return True # Ensure this old segment can now be named engine.execute(ns_table.update().values(name='Zeus').where( ns_table.c.standard_attr_id == standard_id)) class TestNetworkSegmentNameDescMySql(NetworkSegmentNameAndDescriptionMixin, test_migrations.TestWalkMigrationsMysql): pass class TestNetworkSegmentNameDescPsql(NetworkSegmentNameAndDescriptionMixin, test_migrations.TestWalkMigrationsPsql): pass

commit_message:
Stop using mox in unit/consistencygroup/*.py tests

All test cases that use mox should be updated to use mock instead.

commit_message:
Add lpmqtt repos to infra

lpmqtt is a daemon for publishing an event stream from launchpad onto
mqtt and will be run in infra. This commit adds the repos under infra
on projects.yaml

commit_message:
Detect DBReferenceError when deleting flavor

The flavor framework currently has a TODO where the logic
to ensure the flavor isn't in use should be. Implementing
this logic will be a bit complicated this late in the cycle
since many different services can depend on the flavor.

For now we can at least catch the DBReferenceError when trying
to delete the flavor and convert it into the FlavorInUse
exception.

This leaves some notes inline about how we might go about
implemented the _ensure_flavor_not_inuse function.

Change-Id: I6bfe61645c6cee002020a507e489c3535d5026ab
Closes-Bug: #1621281

commit_message:
python-openstackclient: Remove BuildRequires for doc build

Having the other python-*client packages as BuildRequires for the
documentation creates build cycles.
We need to find a better solution for that but for now removing the
BuildRequires which are only for documentation needed is fine.

Change-Id: I1d7e8cd293b984694f941b1819d581cd3259726b

commit_message:
Add service networks to hieradata

This adds a mapping of which service is on which network. This
information can be used to fetch a certificate depending on the
network (since they use different hostnames).

Change-Id: I176245da591bea28aeabf3d2b552f24456c98c43
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/75/365475/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ServiceNetMap: type: json # Dynamically generate per-service network data # This works as follows (outer->inner functions) # yaql - filters services where no mapping exists in ServiceNetMap # map_replace: substitute e.g heat_api_network with network name from ServiceNetMap # map_merge/repeat: generate a per-service mapping - yaql: # This filters any entries where the value hasn't been substituted for # a list, e.g it's still $service_network. This happens when there is # no network defined for the service in the ServiceNetMap, which is OK # as not all services have to be bound to a network, so we filter them expression: dict($.data.map.items().where(isString($[1]) and not $[1].endsWith("_network"))) data: map: - map_replace: - map_merge: repeat: template: SERVICE_network: SERVICE_network for_each: SERVICE: str_split: [',', {get_param: enabled_services}] - values: {get_param: ServiceNetMap}

commit_message:
Use command to avoid alias execution for log compression in CI

To avoid executing an alias and therefore get the default behavior
from gzip, executing gzip with command is better than using which.

Change-Id: I376af163a0b7c7aec3ba5d323d3f9c4128b55735
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/30/367330/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: bash -c 'command gzip --best --recursive "{toxinidir}/logs/"'

commit_message:
Removal deprecation warning for max_fixed_ips_per_port

There are cases where plugins make use of a DHCP service that only
enables a 1:1 mapping of MAC addresses to a fixed IP. This
validation ensures that a tenant will not configure more than one
fixed IP per port.

Related-bug: #1502356

Change-Id: Ic954d22ecc99d5931f64e08d228376c1bc5f0dc5

commit_message:
removed redundant handler and flushed handler right away

loading lxc-openstack profile into apparmor is done with service reloading,
so the redundant loading handler of lxc-openstack is removed.
The reloading handler is flushed right away in case of interrupted execution.

Change-Id: I7a0e9d886808e0949a0e8301c6a5ea2994c6cd49
closes-bug: 1620757

commit_message:
Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented

NotImplementedError is the name of the exception
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/exceptions.html).
NotImplemented is the name of a constant
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/constants.html).
>>> raise NotImplemented()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#0>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplemented()
TypeError: 'NotImplementedType' object is not callable
>>> raise NotImplementedError()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#1>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplementedError()
NotImplementedError

This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I6cc2123f58ca41c2bd5b23312f167867d8b0bf9d
Closes-Bug: #1339855
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/61/365561/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: raise NotImplementedError

commit_message:
Catch more specific exception in compute manager

Currently in compute manager, we simply treat all the exception
as general 'Exception', we should catch more specific exception.

Change-Id: Id20c663eed308f1c0d94b3528f3694ad8c532226

commit_message:
Fix pep8 issue in stable/mitaka

There is a pep8 issue affecting some back ported fixes to stable/mitaka.
This was fixed in master under some new function defect without anyone
being fully aware it was happening.  This bug is to unwedge fix
backports to stable/mitaka.

Change-Id: I527bf722b16006197a51bc027654a2ceb3f4c4b8
Closes-Bug: 1621292

commit_message:
Add --dry-run option to nailgun-agent

It's a bit hard to debug nailgun-agent, because it
tries to send info over http somewhere and sleeps at
the beginning. So you can't run it on your desktop, for
example.

Let's add --dry-run option, to have ability to just get
and print all information.

This is a small improvement, so no bug or blueprint.


Change-Id: If7309635d40ff3263a671fddd7df20efd917097c
(cherry picked from commit c5f7deaa98c8b137d8d08d8d8c0c2f8406277576)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-nailgun-agent refs/changes/08/366508/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'optparse' def initialize(logger, dry_run) unless dry_run @api_ip = URI(@settings['url']).host || API_DEFAULT_ADDRESS scheme, api_port = get_scheme_and_port @api_url = "#{scheme}://#{@api_ip}:#{api_port}/api" @logger.info("API URL is #{@api_url}") end def print s = _data.to_json @logger.info("Data collected by nailgun-agent:") @logger.info(s) enddry_run = false OptionParser.new do |opts| opts.banner = "Usage: nailgun-agent [options]" opts.on("-d", "--dry-run", "Only print collected information, don't send it anywhere.") do |_d| dry_run = true end end.parse! unless dry_run sleep_time = rand(30) logger.debug("Sleep for #{sleep_time} seconds before sending request") sleep(sleep_time) endagent = NodeAgent.new(logger, dry_run)if dry_run agent.print exit 0 end
deleted_lines: def initialize(logger) @api_ip = URI(@settings['url']).host or API_DEFAULT_ADDRESS scheme, api_port = get_scheme_and_port() @api_url = "#{scheme}://#{@api_ip}:#{api_port}/api" @logger.info("API URL is #{@api_url}")sleep_time = rand(30) logger.debug("Sleep for #{sleep_time} seconds before sending request") sleep(sleep_time)agent = NodeAgent.new(logger)

commit_message:
Imported Translations from Zanata

commit_message:
Spec for l3 cache usage meter

Change-Id: Iace61521296ec7bc0cab4a29b7972af6ecd59019
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/telemetry-specs refs/changes/55/311655/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========================================== add new meter for l3 cache usage statistics =========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/l3-cache-meter Some Intel processor families (e.g. the Intel Xeon processor E5 v3 family) introduced CMT (Cache Monitoring Technology) to measure the usage of l3 cache by applications running on the platform. This spec introduces one new meter to get l3 cache usage statistics based on Intel CMT feature. Problem description =================== The usecase is to get l3 cache usage statistics based on this new meter. Proposed change =============== Add new meter for l3 cache usage. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Pipeline impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance/Scalability Impacts ------------------------------- None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: qiaowei-ren Work Items ---------- * Add new pollster for l3 cache; * Extend libvirt inspector to support l3 cache. Future lifecycle ================ None Dependencies ============ This spec will depend on the following libraries: * libvirt >= 1.3.4 Testing ======= Related tests will be added. Documentation Impact ==================== The Measurement docs need to be updated to reflect new meter. References ==========

commit_message:
Update releases table from openstack.yaml

New item has been added to attributes_metadata in openstack.yaml
fixture. But this items could only get to the database by running
manage.py loaddata. Since we can't do it during update from 9.0
to 9.1 let's add corresponding code to alembic migration.

Change-Id: I1371786550d1bc6378d0d8ccf2bdcd6da15e255a
Closes-Bug: 1616549

commit_message:
Update python-congressclient to 1.5.0

- Add missing Group to package
- Remove python-keystoneclient from Requires and BuildRequires
- Remove python-openstackclient from Requires
Both are no longer needed.

commit_message:
Fix No sql_connection parameter is established

It seems we are running into an intermittent issue where the
session params are not fully mocked causing a
'No sql_connection parameter is established'.

Change-Id: I115d89199118db86d64cb750669c969bada3e401
Closes-Bug: #1621211

commit_message:
clean up the spec repo for newton

a few things to note here:

  - the ldap3 spec was never implemented and probably no longer
    needed, moved to superseded
  - the online schema migration spec in the backlog was also
    moved to superseded since we merged "manage migrations"
  - the microversions spec was moved to the backlog, it was not
    implemented in newton

Change-Id: Ibd924c9104d82c9683dc2455580c2088da6b7fe1

commit_message:
standardize release note page ordering

In order to support automatically updating the release notes when we
create stable branches, we want the pages to be in a standard order.
This patch updates the order to be reverse chronological, so the most
recent notes appear at the top.

Change-Id: Ib364dcc8eb31275a31c83b68d7914263b183e393
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Point auditor service at the replicator config

When running dedicated replication network we need the auditor service
to point at the configuration file with the replicator.

Without this we will get errors in the various servers indicating the
replicator service can not be found by the auditor service:

object-auditor: STDOUT: Unable to find object-replicator config section
in /etc/swift/object-server/object-server.conf

Change-Id: Idd5e6ddab66a7855959e93139d2c7934762c6ba9
(cherry picked from commit 599232af302a2bb70dc717fd45967561a923590b)

correct input params in get_samples

not get_samples(self, manager, context)

subject: Add support for multi delete
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 05:29:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tackerclient/commit/83a553ef843c1e95b1c70a6a8c1359fabbb2d408', 'message': 'Add support for multi delete

Currently Tacker client support single resource(i.e VNFD, VNF or

commit_message:
Add support for multi delete

Currently Tacker client support single resource(i.e VNFD, VNF or
VIM) deletion per call. With this fix, multiple VNFs, VNFDs or
VIMs can be deleted in a single client call.

Change-Id: I0819d94e14637d8e9d8a7b2afb5f948587e00ce0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tackerclient refs/changes/06/349806/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'ids', nargs='+', metavar=self.resource.upper(), failure = False err_msg = _("Unable to delete the specified %s(s)." % self.resource) for resource_id in parsed_args.ids: tacker_client = self.get_client() tacker_client.format = parsed_args.request_format obj_deleter = getattr(tacker_client, "delete_%s" % self.resource) try: if self.allow_names: _id = find_resourceid_by_name_or_id(tacker_client, self.resource, resource_id) else: _id = resource_id obj_deleter(_id) print((_('Deleted %(resource)s: %(id)s') % {'id': resource_id, 'resource': self.resource}), file=self.app.stdout) except Exception as e: failure = True print(e) if failure: raise exceptions.CommandError(err_msg)
deleted_lines: 'id', metavar=self.resource.upper(), self.log.debug('run(%s)', parsed_args) tacker_client = self.get_client() tacker_client.format = parsed_args.request_format obj_deleter = getattr(tacker_client, "delete_%s" % self.resource) if self.allow_names: _id = find_resourceid_by_name_or_id(tacker_client, self.resource, parsed_args.id) else: _id = parsed_args.id obj_deleter(_id) print((_('Deleted %(resource)s: %(id)s') % {'id': parsed_args.id, 'resource': self.resource}), file=self.app.stdout)

Fix adds check for failed configuration

If there are failed deployments on some configs
job will fail.

Closes-Bug:1593266

commit_message:
Remove second slave monitor for RabbitMQ resource

If the OCF script monitor action takes more than a minute, Pacemaker
does not react on a returned error. Removing one of two slave
monitors fixes that problem. The second monitor does not bring any
value, so that change does not have any downside.

Change-Id: I22adebbfeed1f128c068dc2a15d0f374337a32d4
Closes-Bug: #1618843

commit_message:
XtremIO: fix bug deleting cgsnapshot

the client API is called with method DELETED intead of DELETE
- was introduced by mistake in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/346831/
- add unit test to prevent regression

Closes-Bug: #1619283
Change-Id: I6cefe55c4632f424f610f826a5bb62edc29d9127

environments with internally signed certificates by allowing the
certificate location to be specified in the pip_install_options

commit_message:
Use pip_install_options when creating reqt wheels

This prevents pip SSL certificate verification failures in
environments with internally signed certificates by allowing the
certificate location to be specified in the pip_install_options
variable.

The pip_install_options variable is also added to the role defaults.

Change-Id: I447e5378254f88ac4fa87a9db3d34221a21e3685
Partial-Bug: 1621596

commit_message:
Bump version of ambari

this version includes fix of bug, that prevents successful
start of kerberized cluster on centos7. Bug report can be found at
[0].

[0] https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMBARI-15961
Closes-bug: 1619920

commit_message:
Adds audit support for VNF, VIM and VNFD resources

This commit enables support to display events for VNF, VIM
and VNFD resoures

Implements: blueprint: audit-support

Co-Authored-By: Kanagaraj Manickam <mkr1481@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I674ec9b2b55c45ed46c8306d8b1394c908ca2241
Depends-On: Ia54aed6720043840b00dd2eb00ca03a2ed92da5e

added_lines: import loggingfrom horizon import messagesLOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class VNFEventsTab(tabs.Tab): name = _("Events Log") slug = "events" template_name = "nfv/vnfmanager/_detail_events.html" preload = False def get_context_data(self, request, **kwargs): vnf = self.tab_group.kwargs['vnf'] LOG.debug('vnf = %s' % vnf) LOG.debug('vnf[vnf][id]= %s' % vnf['vnf']['id']) try: events = api.tacker.events_list( self.request, vnf['vnf']['id']) LOG.debug('events %s' % events) except Exception as e: LOG.debug("exception msg = %s " % e) events = [] messages.error(request, _( 'Unable to get events for vnf "%s".') % vnf['vnf']['id']) return {"events": events, "table": tables.EventsTable(request, data=events)} tabs = (VDUDetailTab, VNFEventsTab)

commit_message:
Refresh info_cache after deleting floating IP

When deleting a floating IP associated with Neutron's info_cache we don't
refresh the info_cache after it is deleted.
This patch makes it so the info_cache is refreshed when an associated
floating IP is deleted. If there is no info_cache associated with the
floating IP then info_cache is not refreshed.

Change-Id: I8a8ae8cdbe2d9d77e7f1ae94ebdf6e4ad46eaf00
Closes-Bug:  #1614538

Fix password masking result

This patch fixes an issue where the method tracing was returning the
masked password, instead of the original return result.

Closes-Bug: 1616527

is not direct and accurate, so this patch provide the direct link and
delete the useless link.

commit_message:
Support over subscription and thin provisioning for ScaleIO

Added documentation regarding ScaleIO over subscription and
thin provisioning capabilities.

Change-Id: I2a843bf123b5443874bdaa62503b21ef52098d99
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/70/365070/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: provisioning:type = thin\thick The old specification: ``sio:provisioning_type`` is deprecated. Over subscription ----------------- Configure over subscription ratio by adding the following parameter under the seperate section for ScaleIO: .. code-block:: ini sio_max_over_subscription_ratio = OVER_SUBSCRIPTION_RATIO or by adding the following parameter under the default section: .. code-block:: ini max_over_subscription_ratio = OVER_SUBSCRIPTION_RATIO Note that if both are specified, ScaleIO will consider only the first, and if none are specified there will be no over subscription. over subscription is calculated by Cinder correctly only if the extra specification ``provisioning:type`` appears in the volume type regardless to the default provisioning type. Maximum over subscription value supported for ScaleIO is 10.0. Default provisioning type -------------------------

commit_message:
Adding V-38438 (auditd during boot)

This patch adds a task and handlers for enabling the audit daemon
during the boot sequence to comply with V-38438. Deployers have
the option to opt-out of the entire change, or they can apply the
change without updating the active grub.cfg file.

Change-Id: Ia8702b8439a5993516397363b21356f1216be403
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/63/354363/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # V-38438 requires that auditd is enabled at boot time with a parameter in the # GRUB configuration. # # If 'security_enable_audit_during_boot' is set to 'yes', then the 'audit=1' # parameter will be added in /etc/default/grub.d/. # If 'security_enable_grub_update is set to 'yes', the grub.cfg will be # updated automatically. security_enable_audit_during_boot: yes # V-38438 security_enable_grub_update: yes # V-38438

subject: Enable Gnocchi role lifecycle var for Identity
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-07 19:41:44.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/gnocchi_identity_setup.yml', 'tasks/gnocchi_service_setup.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_gnocchi/commit/2f40fd77ff7e32b43aa35e84da45a9b8a04f5889', 'message': "Enable Gnocchi role lifecycle var for Identity

Because Gnocchi depends on Swift to exist in the service catalog
and be available when using Swift storage, the Gnocchi role must be
run after the Swift service is installed. However the Swift service
benefits from the existence of the Gnocchi roles' identity artifacts
in Keystone when it is configured.

To work around this circular dependency, a special role lifecycle
var is introduced to limit the scope of execution of the Gnocchi
role to only creating the identity artifacts so that this role can
be executed quickly and safely before Swift is installed to allow
Swift to be properly configured, and again without that variable
set after Swift is installed to perform the standard install of
Gnocchi.

No release note or special documentation is provided since this is
still targeting the first release cycle of OpenStack-Ansible with
this role and no special documentation exists for the lifecycle vars
in other services (such as galera_server).

Change-Id: If4fa5c1c4401911057f99488694d74f5d83330a8
"}]
commit_message:
Enable Gnocchi role lifecycle var for Identity

Because Gnocchi depends on Swift to exist in the service catalog
and be available when using Swift storage, the Gnocchi role must be
run after the Swift service is installed. However the Swift service
benefits from the existence of the Gnocchi roles' identity artifacts
in Keystone when it is configured.

To work around this circular dependency, a special role lifecycle
var is introduced to limit the scope of execution of the Gnocchi
role to only creating the identity artifacts so that this role can
be executed quickly and safely before Swift is installed to allow
Swift to be properly configured, and again without that variable
set after Swift is installed to perform the standard install of
Gnocchi.

No release note or special documentation is provided since this is
still targeting the first release cycle of OpenStack-Ansible with
this role and no special documentation exists for the lifecycle vars
in other services (such as galera_server).

Change-Id: If4fa5c1c4401911057f99488694d74f5d83330a8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_gnocchi refs/changes/30/366930/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #: Special role execution lifecycles # Only create Gnocchi's identity entities in Keystone gnocchi_identity_only: False

commit_message:
Use six.wraps instead of functools

Currently constraint for six is >=1.9, so it's time to solve the
TODO point over functools.wraps and make behaviour consistent on py2/py3

Change-Id: I23996a4aec3561c7b0f6fec00a60f8c16b2e22a6

commit_message:

commit_message:
[placement] Allow inventory to violate allocations

When a compute node is reconfigured to have different inventory it
needs to be able to tell the placement service of these changes,
even if they violate existing allocations. Thus, when updating
inventory we no longer check the new capacity against existing
allocations, we just let it happen (but log a warning).

This is safe because allocations in excess of capacity will still
prevent resources from being used.

Change-Id: I48ae1d7cd6bc309243493ddac99ce990c0146534
Closes-Bug: #1619722
Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>

added_lines: # Compute nodes that are reconfigured have to be able to set # their inventory to something that violates allocations so # we need to make that possible. new_total = 1 resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.DISK_GB, total=new_total) rp.update_inventory(disk_inv) usages = objects.UsageList.get_all_by_resource_provider_uuid( self.context, rp.uuid) self.assertEqual(allocation.used, usages[0].usage) inv_list = objects.InventoryList.get_all_by_resource_provider_uuid( self.context, rp.uuid) self.assertEqual(new_total, inv_list[0].total)
deleted_lines: resource_class=fields.ResourceClass.DISK_GB, total=1) error = self.assertRaises( exception.InvalidInventoryNewCapacityExceeded, rp.update_inventory, disk_inv) self.assertIn("Invalid inventory for '%s'" % fields.ResourceClass.DISK_GB, str(error)) self.assertIn("on resource provider '%s'." % rp.uuid, str(error))

commit_message:
Fix inappropriate notification send

The method '_build_and_run_instance' sends inappropriate
notification 'create.end' when an exception is raised, instead
it should be sending 'create.error' notification.

Replaced 'create.end' notification with 'create.error'
when exception is raised.

Change-Id: I2661cc47b6ebb674cce2f2b43851aa9eca12b5f8
Closes-Bug:1578500

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects
instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: I377ac2e0252b2584361addc6bc37d1302c8ee551

commit_message:
Test: make enforce_type=True in conf.set_override

Each config option has limitation for type and value. In production
code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input is valid, but in unit test,
test methods can pass if we use method conf.set_override without
parameter enforce_type=True even we pass wrong type or wrong value
to config option. This commit makes sure calling method conf.set_override
with enforce_type=True.

Change-Id: I0a0aaf43bac0fb3184da2b74a0b27616784a4aad
Closes-Bug: #1517839

commit_message:
standardize release note page ordering

In order to support automatically updating the release notes when we
create stable branches, we want the pages to be in a standard order.
This patch updates the order to be reverse chronological, so the most
recent notes appear at the top.

Change-Id: Ib364dcc8eb31275a31c83b68d7914263b183e393
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Use keystoneauth1 instead of manual setup

This change moves our code to the new keystoneauth1 library.

This allows to wipe out all authentification code from Ceilometer.
Ceilometer become compatible with all keystone API version and
all keystone auth plugin for authentification.

This also moves the keystone project discovery to v3 API,
to fully removes the keystone v2 client from Ceilometer.

Implements blueprint support-keystone-v3
Depends-On: Ia5e924eb58aac7fd53e9fe4a3dbdee102ece3ad7
Depends-On: Ic7bbf9c98eb3f5a5d31da6f313458c4c4d62f59f
Change-Id: Id2938c2b323e935b3da35768f1f75ea3ae65bad5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/37/237537/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: client = keystone_client.get_client(trust_id)

commit_message:

commit_message:
Use scenario for image and keypair unit tests

This reworks the image validation and keypair validation unit tests to
use scenarios.

Change-Id: Ib64765b8d5ec299f23ad4d353bc96ae073546425

subject: [fix gate] Cluster grow not showing locality
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-08 21:46:42.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/scenario/runners/cluster_actions_runners.py', 'trove/cluster/models.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/3ae00fcf694eced693a94d0d8dea2c852880cc0e', 'message': "[fix gate] Cluster grow not showing locality

The scenario tests for clusters are occasionally failing when doing a
cluster-show after a cluster-grow. This seems to happen because the
locality flag on the new instances takes a few seconds (sometimes) to
populate. This results in a 'AssertionError: Cluster missing attribute
locality.' error in the cluster grow test.

The fix is to check all the instances for the server_group information
instead of just the first instance.

The cluster tests were also tweaked so they could be run separately.

Change-Id: I4f369231a8f0bc8cad338e2eb1de9cd1ca0253f6
Closes-Bug: #1621634
"}]
commit_message:
[fix gate] Cluster grow not showing locality

The scenario tests for clusters are occasionally failing when doing a
cluster-show after a cluster-grow. This seems to happen because the
locality flag on the new instances takes a few seconds (sometimes) to
populate. This results in a 'AssertionError: Cluster missing attribute
locality.' error in the cluster grow test.

The fix is to check all the instances for the server_group information
instead of just the first instance.

The cluster tests were also tweaked so they could be run separately.

Change-Id: I4f369231a8f0bc8cad338e2eb1de9cd1ca0253f6
Closes-Bug: #1621634
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/44/367644/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._server_group = None # Not all the instances may have the server group loaded, so # check them all for instance in self.instances: if instance.server_group: self._server_group = instance.server_group break
